sen.j: 民大火（たみのおおひ、生年不詳 - 大宝 (日本)3年（703年）7月23日 (旧暦)？）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAMI no Ohi (the year of birth is unknown - July 23 [lunar calendar]?, 703) was a person of the Asuka era.
TAMI no Ohi (the year of birth is unknown - July 23 [old calendar]?, 703) was a person of the Asuka era.
sen.cmt: 旧暦はold calendar でいいと思いますが、この場合訳さなくてもいいと思います。
sen.e: TAMI no Ohi (year of birth unknown - September 12, 703?) was a person of the Asuka era.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「たみのおほひ」。
sen.e: The reading according to the old Japanese syllabary character is 'Taminoohohi'.
sen.cmt: 「おほひ」の正式な表記が不明。
sen.e: The reading according to the old Japanese syllabary character is 'Taminoohohi'.
The reading according to the old Japanese syllabary character is 'Taminoohohi'.

sen.j: 姓は直、後に連、さらに後に忌寸。
sen.e: His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai, then Muraji, and after that Imiki.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai, then Muraji, and after that Imiki.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai, then Muraji, and after that Imiki.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側の高市皇子に従って都を脱した。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War, in 627, TAMI no Ohi was a retainer of Prince Takechi, who took sides with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and he made an escape from the capital.
In the Jinshin War, in 627, TAMI no Ohi was a retainer of Prince Takechi, who took sides with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and he made an escape from the capital.
In the Jinshin War, in 627, TAMI no Ohi was a retainer of Prince Takechi, who took sides with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and he made an escape from the capital.
He attained the rank of Shogoinojo (the fifth rank, upper grade).
sen.cmt: 贈正五位上=定訳不明「彼は正五位上を得た。」と訳しました。
sen.e: He attained the rank of Shogoinojo (the fifth rank, upper grade).
He attained the rank of Shogoinojo (the fifth rank, upper grade).

sen.j: 民氏は倭漢氏（東漢氏）に属する渡来人系氏族である。
sen.e: The TAMI clan was decended from toraijin (settlers from overseas) and belonged to the Yamatonoaya clan.
sen.cmt: 倭漢氏（東漢氏）=定訳不明「the Yamatonoaya clan」
sen.e: The TAMI clan was decended from toraijin (settlers from overseas) and belonged to the Yamatonoaya clan.
The TAMI clan was decended from toraijin (settlers from overseas) and belonged to the Yamatonoaya clan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、民大火は近江近江宮にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, it seemed that TAMI no Ohi was in Omi palace.
sen.cmt: 原文「近江近江宮」となっていますが「近江宮」で訳出しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, it seemed that TAMI no Ohi was in Omi palace.
When the Jinshin War broke out, it seemed that TAMI no Ohi was in Omi palace.

sen.j: 大海人皇子の挙兵を知ってその子高市皇子が大津京を脱出し、6月25日に鹿深を越えて積殖山口で大海人皇子の一行に合流したとき、皇子には民大火以外に赤染徳足、大蔵広隅、坂上国麻呂、古市黒麻呂、竹田大徳、胆香瓦安倍が従っていた。
sen.e: Knowing of the raising of an army by Prince Oama, his son, Prince Takechi made an escape from Otsukyo, and when he went through the Kafuka area on June 25, and joined up with Prince Oama's group in Tsumue yamaguchi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe were following the prince.

After finding out that Prince Oama raised an army, his son, Prince Takechi made an escape from Otsukyo, and when he went through the Kafuka area on June 25, and joined up with Prince Oama's group in Tsumue yamaguchi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe were following the prince.
sen.cmt: Knowing of… より After finding out… の方がこの場合自然です。
sen.e: After finding out that Prince Oama raised an army, his son, Prince Takechi made an escape from Otsukyo, and when he went through the Kafuka area on July 28, 672 and joined up with Prince Oama's group in Tsumue yamaguchi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe were following the prince.

sen.j: 鹿深は近江国甲賀郡と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed that Kafuka area is present day Koga County, Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 鹿深＝定訳不明「Kafuka area」
sen.e: It is presumed that Kafuka area is present day Koga County, Omi Province.
It is presumed that Kafuka area is present day Koga County, Omi Province.

sen.j: 積殖山口は、後の伊賀国阿拝郡柘植郷（現在の伊賀市柘植）と推定される。
sen.e: It is presumed that Tsumue yamaguchi later became Tsuge no go (Tsuge township), Ae County, Iga Province (now Tsuge, Iga City).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 柘植郷＝定訳不明「Tsuge no go (Tsuge township)」
sen.e: It is presumed that Tsumue yamaguchi later became Tsuge no go (Tsuge township), Ae County, Iga Province (now Tsuge, Iga City).
It is presumed that Tsumue yamaguchi later became Tsuge no go (Tsuge township), Ae County, Iga Province (now Tsuge, Iga City).

sen.j: 当時は伊勢国に属した。
sen.e: In those days, it belonged to Ise Province.
In those days, it belonged to Ise Province.
In those days, it belonged to Ise Province.

sen.j: 天武天皇11年（682年）5月16日 (旧暦)に、倭漢直は連の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: YAMATO no Ayano Atai attained Kabane of Muraji on May 16, 682.
YAMATO no Ayano Atai attained Kabane of Muraji on May 16, 682.
YAMATO no Ayano Atai attained Kabane of Muraji on June 29, 682.

sen.j: 14年（685年）6月20日に、倭漢連は忌寸の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: YAMATO no Muraji attained Kabane of Imiki on June 20, 685.
YAMATO no Muraji attained Kabane of Imiki on June 20, 685.
YAMATO no Muraji attained Kabane of Imiki on July 29, 685.

sen.j: 倭漢氏に属する民氏もこれによって姓を変えたと考えられる。
sen.e: The TAMI clan, which belonged to YAMATO no Ayano, also changed their Kabane due to this event.
The TAMI clan, which belonged to YAMATO no Ayano, also changed their Kabane due to this event.
The TAMI clan, which belonged to YAMATO no Ayano, also changed their Kabane due to this event.

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)3年（703年）7月23日に、従五位下民忌寸大火は正五位上の位を贈られ、また、弔いの贈り物をする使者が遣わされた。
sen.e: On July 23, 703, Jugoinoge (the junior fifth rank, lower grade) TAMI no Imiki Ohi attained the rank of Shogoinojo and was sent an envoy who delivered a memorial gift.
sen.cmt: 従五位下民忌寸大火=定訳不明「Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) TAMI no Imiki Ohi」
sen.e: On July 23, 703, Jugoinoge (the junior fifth rank, lower grade) TAMI no Imiki Ohi attained the rank of Shogoinojo and was sent an envoy who delivered a memorial gift.
On September 12, 703, Jugoinoge (the junior fifth rank, lower grade) TAMI no Imiki Ohi attained the rank of Shogoinojo and was sent an envoy who delivered a memorial gift.

sen.j: この日かそれより少し前に死んだと思われる。
sen.e: It is assumed that he died on this day or perhaps few days earlier.
It is assumed that he died on this day or perhaps few days earlier.
It is assumed that he died on this day or perhaps few days earlier.
